author: jinfwhuang
content: I would not disagree with the 2 approaches framework, neither. Based on what I gathered through various discussions, the middle approach has had the most mindshare.

author: jinfwhuang
content: A lot of folks automatically assume that there will be a libp2p based networking layer for the light client.

author: jinfwhuang
content: If we could make portal network to function as designed, that would be the best case scenario. Approach 1 of explicitly setting an RPC endpoint is by far the easiest to implement.

author: .vbuterin
content: For the p2p approach, the main challenge is nailing down exactly what messages get passed around the network

author: .vbuterin
content: Whereas in the N-server approach, it's a much simpler "client asks for what they need, all servers respond" situation

author: .vbuterin
content: So one question for the p2p approach is, do we start immediately standardizing it as part of the portal network, or does it live as a separate network first and then we figure out how to incorporate it into portal later? Is that the choice there?
